intro: Delissea mannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that often root at the nodes. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Delissea mannii thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
